name: Akai APC40 MkII
description: Chatiagne MIDI Module for the Akai APC40 MkII

Controller Mode.description: Choose how the controller responds to input. The APC40 MkII defaults to Generic Mode on start up. If you're using Resolume it's recommended to choose Alternate Ableton Live Mode.

Pad Layout.description: Choose between Ableton Style : Clip Launch Pads named by Track (1-8, left to right), and Clip position (1-5, top to bottom) and Scene Launch Pads numbered 1-5, (top to bottom) or Resolume Style : Clip Launch Pads named by Layer (1-5, bottom to top), and Clip position (1-8, left to right) and Scene Launch Pads numbered 1-5, (bottom to top). Or don't bother, Clip Launch Pads will be Named Clip 1-40 in rows (left to right, bottom to top), Scene Launch Pads 1-5 (top to bottom).

Manual Control.description: Set Pad and Button states by adjusting Values directly below. If you don't want external sources changing these states diconnect Input in Devices above.

Debug.description: Set all module logging to TRUE

Clear Clip Pads.description: Turn off all Lights and Reset Mode

Clear Scene Pads.description: Turn off all Lights and Reset Mode

Set Clip Stop Pad.description: Turn on (or off) one of the Clip Stop pad LEDs. The Stop All Clips pad doesn't have an LED but use this control to trigger it.

Set Track Select Pad.description: Turn on (or off) one of the Track Select pad LEDs.

Set Track Control Pad.description: Turn on (or off) one of the Track Control pad LEDs.

Set Button LED.description: Turn on (or off) one of the button LEDs for those that have them.
